Key Match Events: The match was abandoned due to rain.
George Munsey and Michael Jones added 39 runs off the final 22 deliveries to post a healthy target for Scotland.
Jones scored a four and a six off Adil Rashid in the final over.
Munsey scored a six off Jordan in the 9th over.
Munsey scored a six off Ali in the 7th over.
Jones scored a four off Ali in the 7th over.
Jones scored a six off Archer in the 2nd over.
Munsey scored a four off Archer in the 2nd over.
Pre-Game Insights: Scotland won the toss and opted to bat.
Captain Richie Berrington said, 'Going to bat first, wickets can change. Important to adapt and need to put a good score.'
Captain Jos Buttler said, 'Would have bowled first. Delighted to have Archer back. We have high hopes from him. We are going with extra pacer today.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was reduced to 10 overs per side due to rain.
The revised target for England was 109 runs.
The reserve day rules were discussed before the match.
The rain stopped and the play resumed at 9:50pm IST.
The covers were on at the moment, and the rain delayed the start of play.
Others: The Scotland openers, George Munsey and Michael Jones, were out in the middle to open.
Mark Wood will bowl the first over.
The England and Scotland teams have never faced each other in a T20I before.
Australia and England are expected to dominate the group, but Scotland could be the joker in the pack.
